version.description: The Unicode Consortium has approved the following 41 emoji characters as part of Unicode 8.0, released on June 17, 2015. This is comprised of 37 new emojis, plus five emoji modifiers. Find out more about this update on the Emojipedia Blog.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Religious symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A synague; a place of worship for followers of Judaism. Displayed with a Star of David on the front. Synagogue was approved as part of Unico http://emojipedia.org/synagogue/
emoji_net_data.name: synagogue

bn:00105531a: Of or relating to Jews or Judaism.
Of or relating to a Jew or Jews, their ethnicity, religion or culture.
Being a Jew, or relating to Jews, their ethnicity, religion or culture.
Of or relating to Jews or their culture or religion

bn:00089322v: To love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; to treat or pursue with devotion or adoration.
To venerate someone or something as an idol.
Love unquestioningly and uncritically or to excess; venerate as an idol
To make an idol of, or to worship as an idol.

bn:00076465n: A temple is a structure reserved for religious or spiritual activities, such as prayer and sacrifice, or analogous rites.
Structure reserved for religious or spiritual activities
Place of worship consisting of an edifice for the worship of a deity

bn:00081651n: The devotion accorded to a deity or to a sacred object.
Devotion accorded to a deity or to a sacred object.
Worship is an act of religious devotion usually directed towards a deity.
Worship is an act of spiritual or religious devotion usually directed towards a deity, divine essence, ideal, or specific being.

bn:00043489n: Jews collectively who practice a religion based on the Torah and the Talmud
Judaism is the religion, philosophy, and way of life of the Jewish people.
A religion tracing its origin to the Hebrew people of the ancient Middle-East, as documented in their religious writings, the Torah or Old Testament.
The character, philosophy, principles, or practices distinctive of the Hebrew people.
Judaism, is the religion, philosophy and way of life of the Jewish people.
An Abrahamic religion tracing its origin to the Hebrew people of the ancient Middle East, as documented in their religious writings, the Tanakh.

bn:00075688n: Jewish or Samaritan house of prayer
A synagogue is a Jewish house of prayer.
A place of worship for followers of the Jewish faith.
A congregation of Jews for the purpose of worship or religious study.
A synagogue, also spelled synagog, is a Jewish house of prayer.
(Judaism) the place of worship for a Jewish congregation
